page.title: 03WEST CHARITY, HOCKLIFFE
page.content: In 1690{Francis West}left{Â£400}in his will for the purchase of a freehold estate in{Simpson, Bucks.}The profits from this estate were to be annually distributed for educating the needy children of{Hockliffe}and{Chalgrave.} The'freehold estate' was sold with the development of{Milton Keynes.}Wise investment enables the local children to benefit well from the{Charity.} Despite only having{28}children on roll Hockliffe Lower School can boast its own{BBC'B' Computer, Disc Drive, {Monitor and Printer}thanks to the Charity which also enables the pupils to enjoy weekly swimming. As much as{Â£1,500}is available annually to the school children as a result of the generosity of{Francis West. {Individual}and{group requests}are also considered by the Charity authorities.
